posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
I know that Blackstone has custom class stuff.

That will make alot of stuff here problematic, as the ECB deals with vanilla NWN and not custom stuff.

I may be incorrect, but I think Arkhalia does as well.  Can't say regarding the Nordock in your example.

Here is a good example of what I mean - I play on The PrC repesents Path of Accension as well as WoG.  The former requires builds much, much different than those offered by the ECB, but it is much easier than WoG is.  Legendary levels only adds to the problematic environmental differences that the ECB does not account for (for good reasons!).

WoG is an exceptionally difficult PW (one of the many reasons why I like it so much).

There are many reasons for this - notably that the AB and AC of your opponents mostly outstrip what can be reached by most builds (meaning one will need some extreme measures to compensate for this).  To add to the misery, the custom AI has been tweaked considerably, and the swarm AI coupled with keen insightful feat and spell selection, along with the massive spawn numbers, make for incredibly difficult encounters in some areas.

Some areas are so hard, and the adjusted XP earned so low, that it is anethema to adventure there (unless you are like me, and totally off your rocker!), that most will not make the effort to do them (or attempt to cheese them).

Also, WoG is made for party play.  This means the traditional D&D party (Fighter, Cleric, Mage, rogue) so one solos at one's own risk.

One of the main reasons that ECB builds will work (for the most part) on WoG is that WoG does not depart all that much from Vanilla NWN (there are some differences, but for the most part are not game changing). It is also a +5 mid magic environment, which the ECB builds for the most part are built around.

In any environment that goes beyond +5 (especially +10 and beyond) there is going to be a slant to the power curve of builds. That is just the nature of NWN.

So it should not be surprising if Yunim (a very knowledgeable Builder, btw) says that ECB builds will not do well in such an environment as Blackstone.

Also, one should probably take into consideration PvP here.  Most builds in the ECB are not made (or even viable) for PvP play (either Team or Single matches).

Again, WoG does not have much PvP (I cannot ever remember such happening, as it is based on willingness of both involved parties, and there is not much interest in it).  Other environments (Blackstone, etc) will vary, accordingly.

Last, but not least, is this - if an expert builder like Yunim is giving you advice, I would suggest you hear him out.  And while I applaud your loyalty to the ECB, when a builder like Yunim speaks, I would suggest swallowing that pride and listening to what he is saying, because the guy KNOWS HIS SHIT!

YMMV

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
This post will mainly be about PvM on BSK, specifically endgame content (boss runs / raids).

For reference, there's a build section on the BSK forums with BSK-specific builds.
[https://blackstonekeep.com/viewforum.php?f=25]
Some of them are outdated but they still give a general idea of the sort of builds that work on boss runs.
Especially the ones by this "Yunim" guy, I think some of his builds are pretty good.

The main roles for boss runs are: DPS, healer, and tank.
Some boss runs need other builds (eg. Curse Song Bard, Bigby mage), but generally speaking those are the three main roles.
There's no overall best DPS build but there are roughly 5 build types that are best at specific boss runs.
Although most people (including myself) are lazy and so only have 1 or 2 DPS builds that they use on all boss runs.
The most used ranged DPS is a minmaxed Sorc2/Pal8/AA30, but melee DPS almost always outdamages ranged DPS so only a few people use it.
[https://blackstonekeep.com/viewtopic.php?p=34244#p34244]
The best dedicated healer is a Dru19/Cler20/Bard1, but any caster cleric can be a decent healer provided it has enough WIS and can use arcane banners (server-specific item that allows resting during combat for builds with at least 1 Bard/Sorc/Wiz level).
Rog13/DD26/Figh1 is THE tank. There are other viable tanks (eg. Rog/Barb/Figh), but practically everyone uses a Rog13/DD26/Figh1.
[https://blackstonekeep.com/viewtopic.php?p=33477#p33477]

Battle clerics are terrible on BSK.
It doesn't matter how good of a builder you are, it doesn't matter how good the build is in other environments, if you make a battle cleric it will be terrible on BSK.
In low/medium magic environments battle clerics are usually a top tier build type (along with mages and caster clerics), but in high magic worlds they're not as good.
Everyone has access to +20 AB weapons on BSK, so being able to self-buff to the AB cap is almost useless.
Another thing to consider is that due to the nature of boss runs, the party roles are set in stone. The healers heal and the DPS damages, you can't do both at the same time.
Battle clerics can't out-heal dedicated healers and they can't out-damage dedicated DPS builds, meaning there's no use for them on boss runs.
On top of that they have to rebuff every time they die, and you WILL die on boss runs. Repeatedly.
Compare a battle cleric's buffing routine to a dedicated DPS that only needs an Improved Invisibility wand and, depending on the build, Divine Might before going straight back to attacking.

Shifters are almost universally bad, but due to recent changes there are now a few niche builds like Dru18/BG21/Monk1 that are mediocre (which is quite an achievement for a shifter build).
Dru36/Rog3/Wiz1 is also a fairly niche build but there are two boss runs where it could be useful as a caster rather than a dragon.

I judge DPS builds on their average damage, not AB or burst damage (like smiters).
I've experimented with smiters before, but I would choose a dedicated DPS build over a smiter every time.
An all-smiter party could be pretty fun though, assuming you're able to find other people that want to avoid the usual meta.
Generally speaking, the best DPS build types are: Figh/WM/Pal, Monk/Ass/BG, Rang/BG/Monk, Rang/BG/PDK, Rang/PDK/HS.
Their AB ranges from roughly +65 to +75, but the main advantage they have over other builds is unblockable damage.
The highest STR melee AB is +80 with a minmaxed WM, but that build would get outdamaged on almost every boss run by all of the builds above.
AB is only part of what makes a strong DPS build on BSK.

Your Cler25/CoT8/WM7 would max at roughly +68 AB due to the AB cap, which is about average.
27 (BAB) + 16 (STR) + 4 (Feats) + 1 (WM) + 20 (AB Bonus) = +68
Your Bard7/RDD26/WM7 would max at roughly +73 AB, a Bard8/RDD10/WM22 would max at roughly +77 AB, which are both fairly high.
26 (BAB) + 22 (STR) + 4 (Feats) + 1 (WM) + 20 (AB Bonus) = +73
However, they don't have much unblockable damage and neither of them dual-wield.
The Cler25/CoT8/WM7 would have 2d3 unblockable damage from CoT levels and could be rebuilt for Divine Might at the cost of severely lowering AB.
The duration of Divine Wrath is so short there's no point counting it for boss runs.
The Bard7/RDD26/WM7 / Bard8/RDD10/WM22 doesn't have any unblockable damage.
Both builds could be rebuilt for dual-wielding at the cost of AB, although due to WM there aren't many spare feats.
Compare those builds to a Figh12/WM25/Pal3 that has +75 AB while dual-wielding kukris, Dev Crit, and 14 uses of Divine Might (Extra Turning is easily available via items).
Even dedicated DPS builds that have lower AB than all of the above builds can still outdamage them on certain bosses due to factors like higher APR or higher unblockable damage.

Whether a build is good or not depends on the environment it's used in.
The ECB focuses on low/medium magic vanilla NWN environments where +5AB/5AC items are the norm.
BSK is a high magic PW where +20AB/6AC is the norm and there are custom changes from vanilla NWN.
Many builds that are considered good on the ECB are bad on BSK and many builds that are considered bad on the ECB are good on BSK.

posts.author: Asturonethoriusaline
posts.content:
Yunim wrote:
Jul 31, 2022
This post will mainly be about PvM on BSK, specifically endgame content (boss runs / raids).

For reference, there's a build section on the BSK forums with BSK-specific builds.
[https://blackstonekeep.com/viewforum.php?f=25]
Some of them are outdated but they still give a general idea of the sort of builds that work on boss runs.
Especially the ones by this "Yunim" guy, I think some of his builds are pretty good.

The main roles for boss runs are: DPS, healer, and tank.
Some boss runs need other builds (eg. Curse Song Bard, Bigby mage), but generally speaking those are the three main roles.
There's no overall best DPS build but there are roughly 5 build types that are best at specific boss runs.
Although most people (including myself) are lazy and so only have 1 or 2 DPS builds that they use on all boss runs.
The most used ranged DPS is a minmaxed Sorc2/Pal8/AA30, but melee DPS almost always outdamages ranged DPS so only a few people use it.
[https://blackstonekeep.com/viewtopic.php?p=34244#p34244]
The best dedicated healer is a Dru19/Cler20/Bard1, but any caster cleric can be a decent healer provided it has enough WIS and can use arcane banners (server-specific item that allows resting during combat for builds with at least 1 Bard/Sorc/Wiz level).
Rog13/DD26/Figh1 is THE tank. There are other viable tanks (eg. Rog/Barb/Figh), but practically everyone uses a Rog13/DD26/Figh1.
[https://blackstonekeep.com/viewtopic.php?p=33477#p33477]

Battle clerics are terrible on BSK.
It doesn't matter how good of a builder you are, it doesn't matter how good the build is in other environments, if you make a battle cleric it will be terrible on BSK.
In low/medium magic environments battle clerics are usually a top tier build type (along with mages and caster clerics), but in high magic worlds they're not as good.
Everyone has access to +20 AB weapons on BSK, so being able to self-buff to the AB cap is almost useless.
Another thing to consider is that due to the nature of boss runs, the party roles are set in stone. The healers heal and the DPS damages, you can't do both at the same time.
Battle clerics can't out-heal dedicated healers and they can't out-damage dedicated DPS builds, meaning there's no use for them on boss runs.
On top of that they have to rebuff every time they die, and you WILL die on boss runs. Repeatedly.
Compare a battle cleric's buffing routine to a dedicated DPS that only needs an Improved Invisibility wand and, depending on the build, Divine Might before going straight back to attacking.

Shifters are almost universally bad, but due to recent changes there are now a few niche builds like Dru18/BG21/Monk1 that are mediocre (which is quite an achievement for a shifter build).
Dru36/Rog3/Wiz1 is also a fairly niche build but there are two boss runs where it could be useful as a caster rather than a dragon.

I judge DPS builds on their average damage, not AB or burst damage (like smiters).
I've experimented with smiters before, but I would choose a dedicated DPS build over a smiter every time.
An all-smiter party could be pretty fun though, assuming you're able to find other people that want to avoid the usual meta.
Generally speaking, the best DPS build types are: Figh/WM/Pal, Monk/Ass/BG, Rang/BG/Monk, Rang/BG/PDK, Rang/PDK/HS.
Their AB ranges from roughly +65 to +75, but the main advantage they have over other builds is unblockable damage.
The highest STR melee AB is +80 with a minmaxed WM, but that build would get outdamaged on almost every boss run by all of the builds above.
AB is only part of what makes a strong DPS build on BSK.

Your Cler25/CoT8/WM7 would max at roughly +68 AB due to the AB cap, which is about average.
27 (BAB) + 16 (STR) + 4 (Feats) + 1 (WM) + 20 (AB Bonus) = +68
Your Bard7/RDD26/WM7 would max at roughly +73 AB, a Bard8/RDD10/WM22 would max at roughly +77 AB, which are both fairly high.
26 (BAB) + 22 (STR) + 4 (Feats) + 1 (WM) + 20 (AB Bonus) = +73
However, they don't have much unblockable damage and neither of them dual-wield.
The Cler25/CoT8/WM7 would have 2d3 unblockable damage from CoT levels and could be rebuilt for Divine Might at the cost of severely lowering AB.
The duration of Divine Wrath is so short there's no point counting it for boss runs.
The Bard7/RDD26/WM7 / Bard8/RDD10/WM22 doesn't have any unblockable damage.
Both builds could be rebuilt for dual-wielding at the cost of AB, although due to WM there aren't many spare feats.
Compare those builds to a Figh12/WM25/Pal3 that has +75 AB while dual-wielding kukris, Dev Crit, and 14 uses of Divine Might (Extra Turning is easily available via items).
Even dedicated DPS builds that have lower AB than all of the above builds can still outdamage them on certain bosses due to factors like higher APR or higher unblockable damage.

Whether a build is good or not depends on the environment it's used in.
The ECB focuses on low/medium magic vanilla NWN environments where +5AB/5AC items are the norm.
BSK is a high magic PW where +20AB/6AC is the norm and there are custom changes from vanilla NWN.
Many builds that are considered good on the ECB are bad on BSK and many builds that are considered bad on the ECB are good on BSK.
Question, do you take the 1 bard level at level 40 for a massive UMD dump?

Also what would recommend as starting Cha?

13? So that can take Divine Might, in case one chooses to fight instead of healing, or if in party with 2,3 healers and so you choose to fight, etc, instead?

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
The Cler25/CoT8/WM7 would still be a bad build even if you rebuilt it for Divine Might and dual-wielding.
All battle clerics are terrible on BSK, every single one of them.

Compare a Cler25/CoT8/WM7 to a Rang25/CoT8/WM7.
Switching would give you an extra 6-7 AB, extra physical damage, and free dual-wielding at no cost.
Cler25/CoT8/WM7 is strictly worse than a Rang25/CoT8/WM7 on BSK.

Even if you rebuilt for Divine Might, compare a Cler25/CoT8/WM7 to a Pal25/CoT8/WM7.
Switching would give you an extra 5-7 AB at no cost.
Cler25/CoT8/WM7 is strictly worse than a Pal25/CoT8/WM7 on BSK.

On top of that, Rang25/CoT8/WM7 and Pal25/CoT8/WM7 could both be further improved to Rang23/CoT10/WM7 and Pal7/CoT26/WM7 respectively.
Cler25/CoT8/WM7 and Pal25/CoT8/WM7 are both builds I consider bad, I would always tell people to build something else if they chose to make one.
Rang25/CoT8/WM7, Rang23/CoT10/WM7, and Pal7/CoT26/WM7 are all builds I consider mediocre, there are better builds but I wouldn't mind if somebody chose to make one.
All of these builds would be out-damaged by top tier DPS builds, but at least the mediocre builds are optimal for what they are.
I can do this sort of thing for any battle cleric, on BSK it's just a waste of levels.

The Bard7/RDD26/WM7 is a build I'd consider bad, a Bard8/RDD10/WM22 is mediocre.
The extra RDD levels give you nothing, while extra WM levels increase AB.
I'd still recommend you play other builds over both though.

There is a big difference between a Dru19/Cler20/Bard1 and a Dru19/Cler20/Monk1.
Arcane banners are extremely important for healers, even the 70ish heals that build has won't be enough for some boss runs.
If you want an alternative Cleric you can try builds like Dru19/Cler20/Wiz1, Cler38/Bard1/Rang1, or Cler38/Monk1/Wiz1.
Any healer that can't use arcane banners is a bad choice for boss runs.

A Dru19/Cler20/Bard1 will not be fighting, the only thing healers do on boss runs is heal.
If there are more healers than needed then either someone will swap to a DPS toon or you'll take turns healing.
My personal choice for Dru19/Cler20/Bard1 is a gnome with 6STR/8DEX/18CON/18WIS/12INT/8CHA starting abilities.
Healing and Trickery domains, max WIS, take Silent Spell and Great Wisdom 6.
You can choose the other feats yourself, but you'll end up taking the same feats as everyone else if you build it optimally.
The Bard level doesn't have to be at level 40, but I'd recommend 38-40 so that you can get 40 UMD after the -1 CHA modifier.

Asturonethoriusaline wrote:
Jul 30, 2022
 And in each of them I was told that these expert builds Suck(I don't think they suck, disagree with them.

They said that these top, best of the best builds from, in ECB here, Suck at epic, end game bosses, in, vs raids, etc.

To be fair, these PW's do have +10 to +13 EXTREMELY HIGH MAGIC PW's.
Sorry, late to the party, but you seemed to have answered your own question, inadvertently.  Just a few things about the ECB:

1. Nowhere do any of the builders tout the builds as being expert.  On the contrary, many are experimental, role-playing, or done by folks just starting out. Some try to be the best at one thing, or are a novelty, or sometimes just totally unique.  It's not always about the highest AB (and if it were what a boring universe we seem to occupy).
2. Every build should have in it's initial heading which enviroment it is suited for: Player vs Environment (or Player vs Machine), Player vs Player, and then Low Magic, Mid-Magic, or High.  All of this should be right up front in each build, or at least it used to be.  
3.  I'll be the first to say most of my builds would suck in a high-magic world (with a few exceptions).  

So I think you kind of arrived at the how, but maybe not sure as to the why.  Anyway, preaching to the choir....

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
I recommend either RDD or WM, but not both.  A Bard / RDD / WM build is extremely feat-starved.  Even without Martial Weapons and Knockdown, you are still forced to take pre-epic feats in epic levels, which means fewer epic general feats available for Great Strength.

A Fighter / Bard / RDD will have both good AB and AC, and that build is very feat-rich.

A Fighter / Bard / WM will have even better AB but not-as-good AC.  That build will be neither feat-starved nor feat-rich, easily covering all the basics, but with not much room for the nice-to-have feats.
